sect1.title: Internal Component Design
sect1.para: The component UDSServiceHandler Integration consists of only one SW unit: UdsTask.c

The architectural overview of the component is described within the SWA at the following location in Enterprise Architect: VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.UDS_Service_Chorus.SW Architecture.UDSServiceHandler Integration.Components

sect1.title: Requirements Allocation
sect1.para: Since 'UDSServiceHandler Integration' is only dealing with Task APIs, and the Task APIs are derived out from Architecture decisions. There are no SW requirements attached to it. see Component Diagram "Requirements traceability" in SWA at the following location in Enterprise Architect: VW_ICAS1.Chorus.All_Cores.SoftwareDecomposition.ComplexDeviceDrivers.UDS_Service_Chorus.SW Architecture.UDSServiceHandler Integration.SW Requirements

sect1.title: Software Unit Interfaces
sect1.para: The component consists of only one unit. There is no unit interface description needed.

sect1.title: Software Unit Interaction
sect1.para: The component consists of only one unit. There is no unit interaction description needed.

sect1.title: Data flow Diagram
sect1.para: There is no dataflow inside UdsTask. It deals with the Task API and it also deals with the 'Task Setup', 'Task Stop', 'Task Alive'.
It deals with cyclic task DiagTask.
There is no event-handling designed. Operating Modes
There are no special operation modes used. Power Modes
High power mode is used. Exception and Error Handling
A special exception or error handling is not necessary. Synchronization
A special synchronization method is not necessary. Operations
The operations are mentioned in the proper function description.
